channel.title: BareStage: On The Air
channel.itunes:author: BareStage Theatre
channel.description: Retellings of timeless short stories, the best of classic old time radio and original audio dramas in a new form for the 21st century. The BareStage Theatre can be found online at BareStage.com and by email at bareStage@pacbell.net. Check out our other podcast, "BareStage: New Stages," at http://feeds.feedburner.com/NewStages.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Timeless Stories For A New Age
channel.itunes:summary: Retellings of timeless short stories, the best of classic old time radio and original audio dramas in a new form for the 21st century. The BareStage Theatre can be found online at BareStage.com and by email at bareStage@pacbell.net. Check out our other podcast, "BareStage: New Stages," at http://feeds.feedburner.com/NewStages.

item.title: 2. Three Skeleton Key
item.itunes:author: BareStage
item.description:
Tonight, we journey to a lonely lighthouse off the steaming jungle coast of French Guiana and a nightmare world of violence and terror, as the BareStage Theatre On The Air brings you "Three Skeleton Key," by George Taoudouze.
Audio, Editing & Performance
item.itunes:subtitle:
Tonight, we journey to a lonely lighthouse off the steaming jungle coast of French Guiana and a nightmare world of violence and terror, as the BareStage Theatre On The Air brings you "Three Skeleton Key," by George Taoudouze.
Audio, Editing & Performance

item.title: 1. Fishhead
item.itunes:author: BareStage
item.description: There is someone -- or some thing -- living at Reelfoot Lake. Is it a monster ... or a man who just wants to be left alone? Maybe it's a little of both, in this fondly-remembered horror tale from the pen of Kentucky's Irvin S. Cobb. Check out our other podcast, "BareStage: New Stages," at http://feeds.feedburner.com/NewStages.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the first episode of the BareStage Theatre On The Air, we present "Fishhead," a classic chiller by the immortal Irvin S. Cobb. Enjoy this old-fashioned journey into the abnormal.
item.itunes:summary: There is someone -- or some thing -- living at Reelfoot Lake. Is it a monster ... or a man who just wants to be left alone? Maybe it's a little of both, in this fondly-remembered horror tale from the pen of Kentucky's Irvin S. Cobb. Check out our other podcast, "BareStage: New Stages," at http://feeds.feedburner.com/NewStages.
